body:
Install python3.6 and python3.6-dev and run python3.6 -m pip install -r requirements-cuda.txt
You may need to add a ppa to get these. 
I noticed the program hangs when using 3.5.2 which is the default that Ubuntu 16.04 ships with.
Let me know how it works out for you.

python main.py extract --input-dir workspace/data_dst --output-dir workspace/data_dst/aligned/

when extract face，output-dir/aligned has no file。
@sicilyliulc did you delete any frames while extraction was still occurring?

rename.from: hang at doing align in Ubuntu
rename.to: [Linux] hang at doing align in Ubuntu

body:
> @sicilyliulc did you delete any frames while extraction was still occurring?

It turned out that I had no authority，now，it‘’s ok。

when train ，
python main.py train --training-data-src-dir workspace/data_src/aligned/ --training-data-dst-dir workspace/data_dst/aligned/ --model-dir workspace/model/ --model H128

Saving....
Starting. Press "Enter" to stop training and save model.
2019-03-27 03:13:09.803056: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:332] could not create cudnn handle: CUDNN_STATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

You've somehow have broken dependencies or a corrupted install. No reason to get a segmentation dump. Although multi-gpu for training is apparently unstable based on reading other issues, so maybe this is a result of that.
